html:
Dec 12 (Reuters) - :
*AMAZON-DONATING $1 MILLION TO EDWARDSVILLE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION & WORKING WITH LOCAL & STATE OFFICIALS TO UNDERSTAND WHAT’S NEEDED IN THEIR RECOVERY EFFORTS *AMAZON - PROVIDING EMPLOYEES AND PARTNERS WITH RELIEF SUPPLIES AND SERVICES WITH TRANSPORTATION, FOOD & CLEAN WATER, AND OTHER IMMEDIATE-NEEDS SUPPORT *AMAZON - REACHING OUT TO VICTIMS’ FAMILIES TO SEE HOW CO CAN BEST SUPPORT THEM THROUGH THIS CHALLENGING TIME *AMAZON - ASSISTING EMERGENCY RESPONDERS AS NEEDS ARE IDENTIFIED, INCLUDING PROVIDING ACCOMMODATIONS AND MEALS *AMAZON – EDWARDSVILLE SITE GOT TORNADO WARNINGS THROUGH VARIOUS ALERTS *AMAZON - CO’S TEAM WORKED QUICKLY TO ENSURE AS MANY EMPLOYEES AND PARTNERS COULD GET TO DESIGNATED SHELTER IN PLACE *AMAZON - EMPLOYEES AND DRIVERS EDWARDSVILLE SITE ARE ALLOWED TO HAVE THEIR CELL PHONES *Further company coverage: AMZN.O

  • ((Reuters.Briefs@thomsonreuters.com;))

((Reuters Investor Briefs; email: reutersinvestor.briefs@thomsonreuters.com)) Source Date/Time = 12-DEC-202118:10:18.037 GMT
